The XYDataset Object¶

An XYDataset is used to store x and y data and is used in plotting.

class qexpy.fitting.XYDataSet(xdata, ydata=None, xerr=None, yerr=None, data_name=None, xname=None, xunits=None, yname=None, yunits=None, is_histogram=False, bins=50)[source]¶

An XYDataSet contains a paired set of Measurement_Array Objects, typically, a set of x and y values to be used for a plot, as well as a method to fit that dataset. If the data set is fit multiple times the various fits are all recorded in a list of XYFitter objects. One can also construct an XYDataSet from histogram data, which then gets converted to equivalent X and Y measurements.

Parameters:
  • xdata (array, Measurement_Array, XYDataSet) – The data to be plotted on the x axis.
  • ydata (array, Measurement_Array) – The data to be plotted on the y axis.
  • xerr (array) – The error on the data on the x axis.
  • yerr (array) – The error on the data on the y axis.
  • data_name (str) – The name of the data to be plotted.
  • xname (str) – The name x axis.
  • xunits – The units of the x axis.
  • yname – The name y axis.
  • yunits (str) – The units of the y axis.
  • is_histogram (bool) – Whether the data is a histogram.
  • bins (int) – The number of bins to plot the histogram data in.
XYDataSet.clear_fits()[source]¶

Remove all fit records

XYDataSet.fit(model=None, parguess=None, fit_range=None, print_results=True, fitcolor=None, name=None, sigmas=1)[source]¶

Fit a data set to a model using XYFitter. Everytime this function is called on a data set, it adds a new XYFitter to the dataset. This is to allow multiple functions to be fit to the same data set.

Parameters:
  • model (Function) – The model (linear, gaussian...) to be fit to the data.
  • parguess (list) – A guess for the values of the parameter of the fit.
  • fit_range (list) – The range to plot the fit on.
  • print_results (bool) – Whether to print the results of the fit.
  • fitcolor (str) – The color of the fit.
  • name (str) – The name of the fit.
  • sigmas (int) – The number of sigmas to show in the error band.
Returns:

The parameters of the fit.
Return type:

Measurement_Array
XYDataSet.get_x_range(margin=0)[source]¶

Get range of the x data, including errors and a specified margin.

Parameters:margin (float) – The margin at either side of the graph.
Returns:The x range of the plot.
Return type:list
XYDataSet.get_y_range(margin=0)[source]¶

Get range of the y data, including errors and a specified margin.

Parameters:margin (float) – The margin at the top and bottom of the graph.
Returns:The y range of the plot.
Return type:list
XYDataSet.get_yres_range(margin=0, fitindex=-1)[source]¶

Get range of the y residuals, including errors and a specified margin.

Parameters:
  • margin (float) – The margin at the top and bottom of the graph.
  • fitindex (int) – The index of the fit get the residual range for.
Returns:

The y range of the residuals.
Return type:

list
XYDataSet.print_fit_results(fitindex=-1)[source]¶

Prints the results of a fit. Includes the data name, fit name, fit parameter values, correlation matrix and chi-squared.

Parameters:fitindex (int) – The index of the fit to print.
XYDataSet.save_textfile(filename='dataset.dat', delim=' ')[source]¶

Save the data set to a file.

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – The name of the text file.
  • delim (str) – The delimiter between entries in the text file.
